alert.note: Alert for Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 12:16AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Tunica and southwestern Tate Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1215 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tunica, or 16 miles east of St Francis National Park, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tunica, North Tunica, Arkabutla, Strayhorn, Dubbs, Little Texas, Dooley, Savage, Fox Island, Austin, Clayton, Hollywood, Prichard, Sarah and Evansville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
